title: 107_s1129
content: PROVISIONS RELATING TO CERTAIN OFFICES AND POSITIONS WITHIN THE EXECUTIVE BRANCH. The Executive Schedule pay rates are adjusted annually based on comparability payments for General Schedule employees in the District of Columbia. The adjustment is rounded to the nearest multiple of $100. The Executive Schedule pay rates are adjusted annually based on comparability payments for General Schedule employees in the District of Columbia, rounded to the nearest multiple of $100. Adjustments under this subsection are made before those under subsection (a), and the adjusted annual rate of pay is treated as such for the positions involved. The annual rate of pay for positions is adjusted based on comparability payments for General Schedule employees in the District of Columbia. Adjustments are made before those under subsection (a) and are treated as such for the positions involved. Contract appeals board members' rates are no less than 97 percent of the rate under paragraph (1) and no less than 94 percent in subsection (b)(3). Effective at the beginning of the first applicable pay period after an adjustment in General Schedule pay rates, contract appeals board members' pay rates will be no less than 97 percent of the rate under paragraph (1) and no less than 94 percent in subsection (b)(3). Adjustments will be determined by the President. The President will adjust the rates of basic pay for contract appeals board members under the General Schedule. Conforming amendments will be made to ensure the adjustments are in line with the Executive Schedule. Amendments are made to certain provisions in title 5 of the United States Code, excluding any adjustment under section 5318(b) from the Executive Schedule. Additionally, a limitation on certain payments is added for employees receiving basic pay under specific sections. Amendments to title 5 of the United States Code exclude adjustments under section 5318(b) from the Executive Schedule. A limitation on certain payments is added for employees receiving basic pay under specific sections, with references to level IV of the executive schedule being changed to level III. PROVISIONS RELATING TO CERTAIN OFFICES AND POSITIONS WITHIN THE JUDICIAL BRANCH. Increase in maximum rates of basic pay allowable for certain positions within the judicial branch, including positions covered by section 604(a)(5) of title 28, circuit executives, and personnel of the administrative office of the United States courts. The text discusses amendments to the pay rates for personnel of the administrative office of the United States courts, changing levels from IV to III of the Executive Schedule. Amendments to title 28, United States Code, change the pay levels for personnel of the administrative office of the United States courts from level IV to level III of the Executive Schedule. The amendments made by this Act will be effective for pay periods starting on or after the enactment date.
